intro: Oregandra, commonly known as oregano, is a flowering plant in the mint family, Lamiaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and aromatic, woody stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces lavender-blue flowers in the summer. Its leaves are oval-shaped and have a strong, pungent aroma, often used in culinary applications. Oregandra is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight.
